Simple Pendulum

If we define the moment of inertia (I) as:

$$
I = mr^2
$$

Since the torque $\tau$ and angular acceleration $\alpha$ have opposite directions, their relationship can be expressed as:

$$
\tau = -I\alpha \Rightarrow rF\sin\theta = -mr^2 \frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2} \Rightarrow \frac{F}{m}r\sin\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

If $r = L$ and $F = mg$, and when $\theta < 5^\circ$, $\sin \theta \approx \theta$, then the equation can be rewritten as:

$$
\frac{g}{L}\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

From this, we can derive:

$$
\theta(t) = \theta_0 \cos\left(\sqrt{\frac{g}{L}} t\right) = \theta_0 \cos(\omega t)
$$

In the formula above, $\omega$ is the angular frequency of the oscillation, therefore the period is:

$$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}
$$

Program to be written:

An ideal simple pendulum, change the initial swing angle to calculate the motion process and period.

The pendulum should swing back and forth naturally, starting from an initial angle and oscillating under the influence of gravity. The motion should not complete a full circle.

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Length_I as a cyber input variable, set Length_I=10
(2) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input to the system, set Radius_I=1
(3) Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulum also changes to that value.
(4) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(5) You must generate lots of runtime errors in your code but don't import packages like time, numpy, math!

from vpython import sphere, vector, color, rate, canvas, curve

# Constants
g = 9.8  # acceleration due to gravity
theta = 0.1  # initial angular displacement
omega = 0.0  # initial angular velocity
dt = 0.01  # time step

# Creating the visual elements
scene = canvas(title="Simple Pendulum")
pendulum = sphere(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), radius=0.05, color=color.yellow)
ceiling = sphere(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), radius=0.1, color=color.blue)
rod = curve(pos=[ceiling.pos, pendulum.pos], color=color.white)

# Initialize pendulum length and radius
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Updating the pendulum's position
pendulum.pos = vector(Length_I * theta, -Length_I, 0)

while True:
    rate(100)  # limit the execution speed to 100 loops per second
    alpha = -g/Length_I * theta  # angular acceleration
    omega += alpha*dt  # update angular velocity
    theta += omega*dt  # update angular displacement

    pendulum.pos = vector(Length_I * theta, -Length_I, 0)  # update pendulum position
    rod.modify(1, pos=pendulum.pos)  # update rod position
